    yspec

    Kyle Baron

    2018-11-02

    yspec.Rmd

    About

    The yspec package will read you data specification file when it is written in a specific yaml format.

    library(yspec)

    Example spec file

    An example specification file looks like:

    specfile <- yspec::file_spec_ex()

cat(readLines(specfile)[1:29], sep = "\n")
      SETUP__:
    primary_key: [ID,EVID,SEQ]
    lookup_file: [_yspec_lookup.yml]
  C:
    type: character
    long: commented rows
    values: [".",C]
    lookup: true
  USUBJID:
    type: character
    long: universal subject identifier
  ID:
    long: NONMEM ID number
  EVID:
    lookup: true
  MDV:
    lookup: true
  SEQ:
    long: record type indicators
    values: {concentration: 1, response: 2, other: 3}
  AMT:
    about: [amount, mg]
    long: dose amount
    range: [0,1000]
  II:
    about: [II, hours]
    long: interdose interval
  CMT:
    about: Compartment

    Once the data specification yaml file is written, it can be loaded in R

    spec <- load_spec(specfile)

spec
       col name    type      unit          short                        
    1  C       character .             commented row indicator      
    2  USUBJID character .             USUBJID                      
    3  ID      numeric   .             ID                           
    4  EVID    numeric   .             event ID                     
    5  MDV     numeric   .             MDV                          
    6  SEQ     numeric   .             SEQ                          
    7  AMT     numeric   mg            amount                       
    8  II      numeric   hours         II                           
    9  CMT     numeric   .             Compartment                  
   10  TAFD    numeric   hours         TAFD                         
   11  WT      numeric   kg            Weight                       
   12  EGFR    numeric   ml/min/1.73m2 eGFR                         
   13  STUDY   character .             Study                        
   14  SEX     numeric   .             SEX                          
   15  BQL     numeric   .             below limit of quantification
   16  DV      numeric   ng/mL         DV                           
   17  DV2     numeric   .             DV2                          
   18  HAIR    character .             HAIR                         
   19  CLCR    numeric   ml/min        creatinine clearance         
   20  ALB     numeric   g/dL          adjusted albumin

    Data from specific columns can be printed

    spec$WT
       name  value    
   col   WT       
   type  numeric  
   short Weight   
   unit  kg       
   range 40 to 100

    or summarized

    summary(spec, WT, DV, EGFR)
      Weight (kg)
    type: numeric
    range: [40, 100]
  ------
  DV (ng/mL)
    type: numeric
  ------
  eGFR (ml/min/1.73m2)
    type: numeric
    range: [10, 300]
  ------

    Example to render spec

    The specification object can be rendered to a specification file

    render_spec(spec, stem = "render_spec")

    With output here.

    Example project file

    To create a project-wide data specification document, first create a project file:

    proj <- file_proj_ex()

cat(readLines(proj), sep = "\n")
      SETUP__:
    sponsor: "ABC Pharma, Inc"
    projectnumber: "DEM104101F"
    data_path: data/derived
  DEM104101F_PK:
    description: Population PK analysis data set
  DEM104101F_PKPD:
    description: Population PK/PD analysis data set
  DEM104101F_AE:
    description: AE analysis data set

    The project file refers to other data specification documents, all of which can be rendered to a single comprehensive data specication file.

    Render a project file

    render_fda_define(proj)

    With output here.
